cont.entity_a: The router had good range. The Buffalo WHR-HP-G54 worked well with excellent range. The router provides great wireless range. Great range.
cont.entity_b: Signal strength reduces with walls between the laptop and router.

cont.entity_a: Serious incompatibility problems with several devices.

Experienced intermittent connectivity issues with various devices. The router required a firmware update to resolve connectivity issues with a DSL provider. Connection drops persisted. The router has a tendency to drop connections after several hours. Experiences frequent connection drops, requiring regular resets.
cont.entity_b: DNS passthrough issues prevent it from working in shared mode.

cont.entity_a: The Buffalo WHR-HP-G54 worked well with excellent range and speed. Firmware updates improved performance but connection drops persisted. The router delivered excellent speed and coverage but was sensitive to power surges. Great range and speed, but firmware issues lead to performance degradation over time.
Easy setup and configuration with strong signal strength across a large area.

After a month, the router stopped working and became unresponsive. Initially worked well but failed after a year, leading to the purchase of a new model. Received a defective unit with a high drop rate, leading to a return and refund.
cont.entity_b: Router stopped working after four months of use. Received a broken piece and requested replacement.

cont.entity_a: Poor customer service experience with long hold times and dropped calls.

cont.entity_b: Good for traveling and hotel room use, with a lightweight design and carry case.

cont.entity_a: Inability to change the subnet address restricts remote access via VPN.
cont.entity_b: Router gets hot, so it should not be covered.
